title: Nesting and specificity
description: Component nesting is kept as low as possible (no more than 4).

title: Context vs component / element styles
description: Implementation styles are based on context, visual styles are based on component.
detail: Aesthetic changes should be modifiers on the root component (e.g. .c-button--rounded). Implementation/layout changes should be made on the parent component (e.g. .c-site-header { .c-button { float:right; } })

title: Content driven media queries
description: A media query should simply be added when the content could be better presented, not to suit a device.

title: Content agnostic class names
description: Component class names should not be tied to the content inside the component.
detail: For example using the the class name welcome_message would not be ideal. As that layout / component could be used elsewhere for other purposes a more appropriate class name would be message.

title: Avoid use of IDs
description: IDs have the highest specificity of any CSS selector and as a result they cause issue with overwriting styles in the cascade.

title: Unique ID
description: If IDs are used, they are unique to a page.

title: JS prefix
description: All classes (or id- used in JavaScript files) begin with js- and are not styled into the CSS files.

title: Embedded or inline CSS
description: Avoid at all cost embeding CSS in <style> tags or using inline CSS
detail: Only use for valid reasons (e.g. background-image for slider, critical CSS).

title: CSS Validator
description: The CSS was tested and pertinent errors were corrected.

title: Alpha tested at various breakpoints
description: All pages were alpha tested at several breakpoints.

title: Alpha tested on various browsers
description: All pages were tested on several browsers (Safari, Firefox, Chrome, Internet Explorer, EDGE...)

title: Print styles
description: A print stylesheet is provided and is correct on each page.
